alert.note: Alert for Moffat (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 3:25PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Colorado in the vicinity of Craig. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Sand bagging operations are ongoing with the potential for some structures to flood. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from snow melt. Low-water crossings may be inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 315 PM MDT, Emergency Management reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is expected to occur along Fortification Creek. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Fortification Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Craig. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
